title: Scent of a pop star! Delta Goodrem announces her third fragrance Destiny
text:
Last week, Channel Nine revealed she'll return for another round of judging duties on The Voice Australia next year.

And on Monday, Delta Goodrem took to her Instagram to announce her third fragrance, Destiny.

The 34-year-old Australian songstress revealed that she's been working on the new fragrance for the past 12 months, and is excited to share it with her fans next month.

Scent of a pop star! Delta Goodrem (pictured) announced her third fragrance Destiny... days after it was revealed she will return for The Voice Australia in 2020

'So excited to announce my third fragrance, Destiny!' she wrote on her social media page, sharing the official artwork and perfume bottle.

Dressed for the occasion, the Australian singer-songwriter wore a matching Maroon slip on dress.

The ARIA Award-winning hit-maker then took to her Instagram to share a Polaroid snap of her smiling from ear to ear as she posed by her piano.

'So excited to announce my third fragrance, Destiny!' she wrote on her social media page, sharing the official artwork and perfume bottle

The printed photograph was decorated by a series of crystals.

'When we released Dream I learned all about your dreams! This chapter is about your Destiny, I would love to hear about how you're fulfilling your destiny,' she captioned the post.

She released her first self-titled perfume in 2017, followed by another called Dream in 2018.

Her latest, Destiny, by Delta Goodrem will be available exclusively through Chemist Warehouse with pre-orders going on sale October 29.

Fulfilling her Destiny! Delta released her first self-titled perfume in 2017, followed by another called Dream in 2018

Meanwhile, the news of Delta's return to The Voice comes after rumours after her fellow Voice judges had been playing 'hardball' for more pay and even threatened to quit if they weren't handed more cash.

'Channel Nine are keen to have exactly the same coach panel as this year, as they think it is the perfect line-up, especially with Guy Sebastian being the standout coach with audiences this year,' a source told New Idea.

'Nine wanted to sign them up for next year before this year's series ended. But the feisty coaches are playing hardball.'
description: Last week, Channel Nine revealed she'll return for another round of judging duties on The Voice Australia next year.
authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
